definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

pinyin: Lan2 Zheng4 Chang2 cheng2 pin3 you2 guan3 dao4

sentences.english: The sapling that bears our mark of love has grown into a big tree
sentences.chinese: 刻下愛的見證的小樹，已長成大樹。

sentences.english: Blair: Oh sweetie, you did not tell me she looked like that. This is such a problem.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的，你可沒跟我說她長成這樣，這可真成問題。

sentences.english: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up
sentences.chinese: 願他們像房頂上的草，未長成而枯乾。

sentences.english: Later they developed a technique for feeding the larvae and rearing them to spat.
sentences.chinese: 後來他們發展了一項技術來餵養幼貝至其長成貝苗。

sentences.english: Since then, I had grown from a fatherless child into a middle-aged man.
sentences.chinese: 從那以後，我已從一個無父的孩子長成一位中年人。

sentences.english: Seeds grow in cones, which themselves are then dispersed by wind, falling to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 種子在球果生長，隨後被風吹落到地面上，長成樹苗。

sentences.english: She has turned into a slim and graceful girl in the years we have been apart.
sentences.chinese: 幾年沒見她已經長成亭亭玉立的大姑娘了。

sentences.english: Years went by. Snow-white grew up and became a little girl.
sentences.chinese: 幾年了，白雪公主長成了小姑娘。

sentences.english: Upon that, they grew up into two trees.
sentences.chinese: 於是，它們在田地裏長成了兩棵樹。

sentences.english: Long into the prime of life, like a baby.
sentences.chinese: 像一個嬰兒長成了壯年。

sentences.english: Man is a child first， after which he attains his youth.
sentences.chinese: 人開始時是個小孩，然後他長成一個年輕人。

sentences.english: Sometimes, it merely nibbles a few leaves; sometimes it kills grown trees.
sentences.chinese: 它有時僅僅咬掉幾片葉子，有時卻燒死長成的大樹。

sentences.english: The goal is to grow in character, in Christ likeness.
sentences.chinese: 目的是讓個性長成基督的樣子。

sentences.english: The wine is made from organically-grown grapes.
sentences.chinese: 這酒是用有機肥料培植長成的葡萄製成的。

sentences.english: And by and by the little boy became a tall and handsome prince.
sentences.chinese: 這個小男孩漸漸地長成了一個高大而英俊的王子。

sentences.english: In that the sweet spring rain, buds grow gradually moist leaves green.
sentences.chinese: 在那甘甜的春雨滋潤下，芽漸漸長成綠綠的葉。

definition: to sprout (leaves, buds, a beard etc)
to drop off/to come off/to lose (hair etc)/to omit (a character when writing)
fruit (produced by a plant)/(fig.) fruits (of success etc)/results/gains
to realize suddenly/to wake up with a start
